title: Bug: Add Server button stays grayed out despite valid input
description:
## Bug Report

The 'Add Server' button in the Add Remote Server dialog remains grayed out/disabled even when valid server details are entered.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to Models section
2. Click '+ Add Server' button
3. Enter valid Host Address (e.g., 10.0.0.175)
4. Enter valid Port (e.g., 47842)
5. Observe: 'Add Server' button is grayed out and non-interactive

## Expected Behavior
The 'Add Server' button should become enabled/clickable once required fields (Host Address, Port) are filled in.

## Actual Behavior
Button remains grayed out regardless of input.

## Screenshot
Desktop/Screenshot 2026-01-14 at 5.23.49 PM.png

## Files to Investigate
- src/components/tabs/ModelsTab.tsx (or similar)
- Look for the AddServerDialog component
- Check the disabled condition on the Add Server button

## Possible Causes
1. Button disabled state tied to connection test result instead of just valid input
2. Form validation logic incorrectly evaluating fields
3. State not updating properly when inputs change

## Acceptance Criteria
- Add Server button enables when Host Address and Port are filled
- Connection test should NOT be required to add a server
- User should be able to add server even if connection test fails (server might be temporarily offline)
close_reason: Fixed in AddServerModal.tsx - button now enables when host is filled, regardless of test status

comments.author: Tom Chapin
comments.text:
ROOT CAUSE: Line 267 in src/components/sections/AddServerModal.tsx:
`disabled={testStatus \!== "success" || saving}`

The Add Server button is intentionally disabled until connection test succeeds. However, this prevents adding servers that are temporarily offline or behind firewalls.

FIX OPTIONS:
1. Allow adding without successful test (just require host+port filled)
2. Add a 'Add Anyway' option after test failure
3. Keep current behavior (requires successful test)

Recommend option 1 or 2 - user should be able to save server config even if currently unreachable.

comments.author: Tom Chapin
comments.text: FIXED: Removed the testStatus check from both the button disabled state and handleAddServer function. Users can now add servers even if connection test fails.

title: Remote Transcription Feature [EPIC]
description:
Allow VoiceTypr instances to offload transcription to more powerful machines on the network. A high-end desktop with a GPU can serve as a transcription server for laptops and less powerful devices.

## Key Design Decisions
- Manual connections only (no auto-discovery in v1)
- Simple password authentication (optional)
- HTTP REST protocol
- Single model per server
- No automatic fallback
- No request rejection - queue instead

See: docs/plans/2026-01-14-remote-transcription-design.md
close_reason: Remote Transcription Feature complete: HTTP server/client, Tauri commands, frontend UI (NetworkSharingCard, AddServerModal, ModelsSection), and integration tests.

title: Bug: Remote servers not loading on app startup - tray menu shows empty
description:
## Bug Report

When app starts, RemoteSettings is initialized with `RemoteSettings::default()` instead of loading saved settings from the store.

**Impact:** Tray menu doesn't show saved remote servers, even though they are saved in the store.

**Root Cause:**
```rust
// src-tauri/src/lib.rs line 376
app.manage(AsyncMutex::new(RemoteSettings::default()));  // WRONG - creates empty settings
```

**Fix:**
```rust
// Should use:
use crate::commands::remote::load_remote_settings;
app.manage(AsyncMutex::new(load_remote_settings(&app.handle())));  // Load from store
```

**Files to modify:**
- src-tauri/src/lib.rs line 376

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Remote servers appear in tray menu after app restart
- Previously saved connections persist across sessions

comments.author: Tom Chapin
Tom Chapin
comments.text:
RESOLVED: Fixed in lib.rs - changed from RemoteSettings::default() to load_remote_settings(&app.handle())

Remote connections now persist and load correctly on app startup.

title: Bug: Network Sharing shows wrong model after changing selection
description:
When user changes the selected model in the Models tab, the Network Sharing 
section still shows the old model (e.g., "large-v3-turbo") instead of the 
newly selected model (e.g., "base.en").

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Enable Network Sharing (shows "large-v3-turbo")
2. Go to Models tab
3. Select a different model (e.g., "Base English")
4. Go back to Settings
5. Network Sharing still shows "large-v3-turbo"

## Expected Behavior
Network Sharing should show the currently selected model, and update when
the user changes their model selection.

## Root Cause
The NetworkSharingCard fetches model info on mount but doesn't:
1. Read the currently SELECTED model from settings
2. Listen for model selection changes

## Fix
- Read current_model from settings store
- Either re-fetch on tab focus, or listen for settings changes
- When sharing is active, restart sharing with new model if changed

title: Bug: Transcription count stuck at 500
description:
## Description
The transcription count on the Overview dashboard stops incrementing at 500. Even though "23 today" shows continued use, the main Transcriptions count remains at 500.

## Observed Behavior
- Transcriptions counter shows 500
- "23 today" indicates new transcriptions are happening
- Counter never increments past 500

Transcription count should continue incrementing beyond 500.

## Likely Cause
There may be a hardcoded limit of 500 entries in:
- The transcriptions store
- The history cleanup/retention logic

title: Diagnostic: Test VoiceTypr server connectivity from Windows host
description:
## Cross-Platform Diagnostic Task

This task is for the WINDOWS PC hosting the VoiceTypr server.
Client (Intel Mac at 10.0.0.88) cannot connect to server (Windows at 10.0.0.175:47842).

## Diagnostic Steps (Run on Windows)

### Step 1: Verify server is listening
```powershell
netstat -an | findstr 47842
```
Expected: Should show LISTENING on 0.0.0.0:47842 (all interfaces)
If it shows 127.0.0.1:47842, server is only accepting localhost connections.

### Step 2: Test localhost connection
```powershell
curl http://localhost:47842/api/status
```
Or:
```powershell
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://localhost:47842/api/status" -UseBasicParsing
```
Expected: Should return server status JSON

### Step 3: Test connection from external IP
```powershell
curl http://10.0.0.175:47842/api/status
```
If Step 2 works but Step 3 fails = firewall blocking

### Step 4: Check Windows Firewall
```powershell
# Check if firewall is enabled
Get-NetFirewallProfile | Select-Object Name, Enabled

# Check for VoiceTypr rules
Get-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName "*voice*" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

# Check what process owns the port
Get-NetTCPConnection -LocalPort 47842 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Select-Object LocalAddress, LocalPort, State, OwningProcess
```

### Step 5: Add firewall rule if needed
```powershell
New-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName "VoiceTypr Server" -Direction Inbound -Protocol TCP -LocalPort 47842 -Action Allow
```

### Step 6: Verify IP address
```powershell
ipconfig | findstr "IPv4"
```
Confirm the server IP matches what client is trying to reach (10.0.0.175)

## Results
Document findings here as comments on this issue.

## Related
- Blocks: voicetypr-4mj (connection failure bug)
- Blocks: voicetypr-hca (remote transcription E2E test)

description:
## Bug Report

When a remote server is selected as the active transcription engine, recordings still use the local Whisper model instead of sending to the remote server.

2. Select the remote server as active model

## Evidence from Logs
```
[01:36:48] Active remote server set to: conn_1768440766671_0
[subsequent transcription still shows:]
voicetypr_lib::whisper::transcriber  <-- LOCAL, not remote
```

## Expected Behavior
When remote server is active, transcription should:
1. Send audio to remote server via HTTP
2. Show logs like `remote::client` or `remote::transcription`
3. NOT use local whisper::transcriber

- src-tauri/src/commands/audio.rs - transcription flow
- src-tauri/src/remote/client.rs - remote client
- src-tauri/src/commands/remote.rs - remote commands
- Check how active model selection is checked during transcription

## Possible Causes
1. Transcription code not checking for active remote server
2. Remote server state not being read correctly
3. Model selection logic prioritizing local over remote

## Bug Report

When selecting a model from the tray menu, the dashboard Models tab doesn't live-update to reflect the change.

## Current Behavior
1. Open Dashboard ‚Üí Models tab

- Dashboard should immediately update when tray menu selection changes
- No tab switching or reopening required
- Selection state should sync in real-time

## Technical Analysis

The tray menu selection triggers model change in backend, but doesn't emit an event that the frontend listens to.

**Current flow:**
1. Tray menu click ‚Üí Rust handler updates state
2. Dashboard React component doesn't know state changed

**Required fix:**
1. Backend should emit event (e.g., 'model-selection-changed' or 'active-model-updated')
2. Frontend ModelsSection.tsx should listen for this event
3. On event, refresh the active model / active remote server state

- src-tauri/src/menu/tray.rs - In the model selection handler, emit event

**Frontend (listen for event):**
- src/components/sections/ModelsSection.tsx - Add listener for selection change event

title: Prevent adding self as remote VoiceTypr
description:
## Problem
Users can point VoiceTypr at itself (localhost or own IP), which creates confusion about which model is being used.

## Solution
1. Generate a unique, deterministic machine ID for each VoiceTypr instance
   - Combine hostname + OS-specific unique identifier (Windows Machine GUID, macOS Hardware UUID)
   - Hash it (MD5/SHA) for obfuscation
   - Must be consistent across restarts

title: Test: Remote transcription end-to-end verification

Verify remote transcription feature works end-to-end before concurrency testing.

### 5. Verify Server Logs

- Verify transcription was processed on server side

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Server starts and shows IP/port
- [ ] Client can connect to server
- [ ] Online status indicator works
- [ ] Transcription request sent to server
- [ ] Transcription result returned to client
- [ ] Text appears in client's history

## Failure Scenarios to Check
- [ ] Wrong password shows authentication error
- [ ] Server offline shows offline indicator
- [ ] Network error shows appropriate message

title: UX: Auto-disable network sharing when remote server selected
description:
CRITICAL BUG: Potential infinite loop in remote transcription

SCENARIO:
- Mac has Windows selected as its remote model AND has network sharing enabled
- Windows has Mac selected as its remote model AND has network sharing enabled
- When either device tries to transcribe, it sends to the other
- The other device, instead of transcribing locally, forwards back to the first
- This creates an infinite loop of forwarded transcription requests

SOLUTION OPTIONS:
1. When acting as a server, ALWAYS use local transcription (never forward to another remote)
2. Add a 'hop count' or 'forwarded' flag to requests to detect loops
3. Prevent selecting a remote server while sharing is enabled (UI constraint)
4. Server should check if the request came from a known remote server and reject

RECOMMENDED: Option 1 - Server mode should ALWAYS transcribe locally, never forward.

FILES TO CHECK:
- src-tauri/src/remote/http.rs - Server transcription handler
- src-tauri/src/commands/audio.rs - Transcription routing logic

comments.author: Tom Chapin
comments.text:
VERIFIED: Server already handles this correctly.

The server's transcribe() method in transcription.rs (lines 155-222) ALWAYS uses local transcription:
- Writes audio to temp file
- Gets model from shared_state.get_model_path() (the LOCAL model being shared)
- Uses local transcriber.transcribe_with_translation()

It does NOT check remote settings or forward requests. The infinite loop cannot happen because server mode always transcribes locally, regardless of what remote server the device has selected as a client.

STATUS: NOT A BUG - architecture is correct by design.
